justification: “Following the introduction of the peers and each iteration of the Cyberball game, participants were prompted to indicate their emotional state via the Self-Assessment Manikin Task (SAM)… This scale… measures three distinct emotional dimensions: arousal, valence, and control/dominance.”
The SAM is described as “a 9-point single-item format to measure three distinct emotional dimensions: arousal, valence, and control/dominance.”
The same passage notes SAM’s third dimension: “control/dominance.”
“Items that asked about general emotions were summed to a ‘Mood’ index… of the Need Threat Questionnaire (NTQ).”
“…questions that inquired about a sense of belonging to a ‘Belonging’ index… of the Need Threat Questionnaire (NTQ).”

“Participants’ perceptions of inclusion or exclusion within a social group were manipulated using the Cyberball paradigm… The percentage of balls they received… was designed to assess whether they actively sensed social exclusion.”
“To assess risky decision-making, a modified version of the Columbia Card Task (CCT)… was employed… Risky decision-making was measured by the number of cards chosen in each trial.”

The CCT “allows researchers to study how individuals adapt their risk-taking to different aspects of the situation, such as varying amounts of gain, loss, and probability of loss… sensitivity to information about gain amounts, loss amounts, and loss probabilities.”
